speaker: EGLAMOUR
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. The DUKE's palace.

speaker: EGLAMOUR
text_entry: Enter THURIO, PROTEUS, and JULIA

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Sir Proteus, what says Silvia to my suit?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: O, sir, I find her milder than she was;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And yet she takes exceptions at your person.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: What, that my leg is too long?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: No; that it is too little.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: I'll wear a boot, to make it somewhat rounder.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  But love will not be spurr'd to what

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: it loathes.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: What says she to my face?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: She says it is a fair one.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Nay then, the wanton lies; my face is black.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But pearls are fair; and the old saying is,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Black men are pearls in beauteous ladies' eyes.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  'Tis true; such pearls as put out

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: ladies' eyes;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: For I had rather wink than look on them.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: How likes she my discourse?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Ill, when you talk of war.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: But well, when I discourse of love and peace?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  But better, indeed, when you hold your peace.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: What says she to my valour?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: O, sir, she makes no doubt of that.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  She needs not, when she knows it cowardice.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: What says she to my birth?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That you are well derived.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  True; from a gentleman to a fool.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Considers she my possessions?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: O, ay; and pities them.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Wherefore?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  That such an ass should owe them.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That they are out by lease.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Here comes the duke.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Enter DUKE

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: How now, Sir Proteus! how now, Thurio!

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Which of you saw Sir Eglamour of late?

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Not I.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Nor I.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Saw you my daughter?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Neither.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Why then,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: She's fled unto that peasant Valentine;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And Eglamour is in her company.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: 'Tis true; for Friar Laurence met them both,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: As he in penance wander'd through the forest;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Him he knew well, and guess'd that it was she,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: But, being mask'd, he was not sure of it;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Besides, she did intend confession

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: At Patrick's cell this even; and there she was not;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: These likelihoods confirm her flight from hence.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Therefore, I pray you, stand not to discourse,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: But mount you presently and meet with me

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Upon the rising of the mountain-foot

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: That leads towards Mantua, whither they are fled:

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Dispatch, sweet gentlemen, and follow me.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Why, this it is to be a peevish girl,

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: That flies her fortune when it follows her.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: I'll after, more to be revenged on Eglamour

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Than for the love of reckless Silvia.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And I will follow, more for Silvia's love

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Than hate of Eglamour that goes with her.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And I will follow, more to cross that love

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Than hate for Silvia that is gone for love.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Exit
